document.masterDocTitle: A taxonomic monograph of the Middle American leaf-litter inhabiting weevil genus Theognete Champion (Coleoptera: Curculionidae; Molytinae; Lymantini) 2458

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: A taxonomic monograph of the Middle American leaf-litter inhabiting weevil genus Theognete Champion (Coleoptera: Curculionidae; Molytinae; Lymantini) 2458

subSubSection.paragraph:
65.
Theognete huitepec Anderson
, new species
( Figures 11 , 143 , 178 , 213 )

Diagnosis. Size. Length, male, 2.89–3.54mm ; female, 2.92–3.88mm . Width, male, 1.57–1.88mm ; female, 1.52–2.02mm . Eyes moderately separated in dorsal view. Pronotum weakly cordate, with vestiture dense, appressed, plumose, concentrated laterally and in two paramedian longitudinal bands; punctures distinct, moderately large and deep. Elytra with scales appressed, short, linearly arranged along intervals, scales of strial regions slightly shorter and finer, but distinct. Posterolateral area of elytra with series of 3–6 contiguous punctures. Aedeagus as in Fig. 178 .
Natural history . Collected from berlese extraction of cloud forest and wet oak forest leaf litter at elevations ranging from 2650–2750m .
Derivation of specific name . Noun in apposition; named after Cerro Huitepec.

Material examined .
41♂ , 46♀♀ ( BMNH , CMNC , CWOB , ECOS , USNM , UVGC )
.
